result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony A. Adkins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony A. Adkins

records.addlTxt:
1:00 PM Defendant Tony A. Adkins in court.  Attorney Blake Duren in court for Tony A. Adkins.  Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and apperances.  Atty Duren notes all matters are resolved.  Court notes there has not been a waiver of prelim in 22CF335.  State states the joint recommendations.  Atty Duren and DE are in agreement. and they will waive the right to a prelim in 22CF335.  DE agrees.  Court questions DE on prelim waiver/accepts/finds probable cause/binds DE over.  Court questions DE on the plea agreement/advises him re: voting rights and felony firearms warnings.  DE pleads NC to count 1 in each of the 3 cases.  Court accepts pleas/finds DE guilty.  State makes statement on behalf of the joint recommendations.  Atty Duren makes statement on behalf of DE.  DE has nothing to add.  Court admonishes DE and sentences.

Adkins appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Parties argue bond.
